Слышала об этой игре довольно давно и решила её купить на одной из распродаж по скидке. 
Игра очень красивая, множество завораживающих и волшебных локаций от которых просто виснет челюсть, но постоянная стрельба и сражения с противниками утомляют (играла на легкой сложности бо ну его нахуй). 
Под рукой у вас прекрасная девушка Элизабет, которая лутает вас жизненно необходимыми предметами  если найдет. (в такую девушку я влюбилась с первого раза, ну вы её видели вообще WAIFU???)
Про сюжет можно писать в стихах, настолько от него можно сойти с ума, настолько и упасть вниз головой об стол. 
Сначала я умирала от мобов 100 раз, а потом в финале я умерла от руки собственной дочери. Может можно было меня в начале прикончить и не трепать мои нервы, блин??? (шутка, конечно, я понимаю, что на этом построен весь сюжет и блаблабла)
Всем спасибо, всем покеда.

grafikler ve hikaye harika.korsan sürümden farkı grafikler orjinal kalitesinde ve korsan sürümle karşılaştırdığımda renk kalitesi olsun görüntü kalitesi olsun bariz fark var..seste orjinal kalitesinde.dilimi desteklemediğinden  türkçe yama uyguladım.hikayeyi anlayamayan arkadaşlar var yorumlara baktığımda.oyunun amacı insanları vicdanının sesini dinlemeye yönlendirmek, kaybolan vicdanlarını geri getirmek.bu amaçlarını  profesyonel bir şekilde oyuna aktarmışlar.tabii dini siyasi birçok şeyide hedeflerine koymuşlar oyunda.o ayrı mesele.sahte peygamber deccale (prophet comstock) karşı; o0yunda sahte çoban diye nitelendirilen (hz.isa a.s) bir uyarıcı,kurtarıcı.oyunda peygamberin tohumu diye nitelendirilen kuzuyu da tahmin edersiniz herhalde değil mi?birçok oyunda olduğu gibi illuminatinin amblemlerini buradada görebilirsiniz.insan dünya nimetlerini,rahatlığı elde edebilmek için neye tapınacaklarını şaşırıyor bunu oyunda bariz bir şekilde görebiliyoruz.bir önemli konuda oyunda waşington,franklin vs. gibi onlar için önemli olan 3 kişiye vurgu yapılmış.ona nasıl tapındıklarını oyunda vaftiz olduktan sonra göreceksiniz zaten.biri bilimin,biri paranın, biri de savaşın anahtarı ve bunların atası 3 şahıs.waşington, franklin diğeride neyse işte.oyuna türkçe oynanamak daha iyi olabiklir sizin için bence.anlamamak daha iyi yani.vurun kırın geçin bence.

It's the game that needs no introduction. BioShock 1 & 3 are easily among the greatest games.

+ Great art style & music
+ Great character design & voice acting, the best companion design
+ Environment narration
+ The story and the philosophy: choice, American Exceptionalism, and myth
- Game play is fun but somewhat repetitive
- Still waiting for the 2011 E3 version

I had never seen a city in the sky before
Floating like an angel in the blue
I'd never felt this time-distorting high before
Until the day that I met you (I met you)
 
And a one, and a two, and a one, two, INFINITE!
 
Let's begin another story on a shadowy sea
With a bulky beacon beckoning mysteriously
Take a journey to a wacky town and start to explore
Is it me or have we sorta done this all before?
 
Now let's stroll through the heavens like aristomocrats
To the sound of white supremacists in fancy blue hats
Yes, the segregated toilets, how they shine like the sun
Ain't freedom grand? Ain't we got fun?
No, the white man's burden isn't chappin' my hide
Whenever you (whenever you) are by my side (are by my side)
 
Because you opened a tear in my heart (dear lady)
opened a tear in my heart... (in my heart)

(platonic pal)
But then you opened a tear in my heart (dear lady)
opened a tear in my heart... (in my heart)
For better or worse, across the whole multiverse,
you will always be my gal
 
Latch upon the frightening public translocation machine
And we'll interrupt the story for a gunslingin' scene
Keep your eye upon the sky 'cause there's a pigeon from hell
Will we make it out alive? Various times will tell
 
I ain't hep to the Vox and their anarchy jive
I'll swig a jigger of a vigor and I'll burn 'em alive!
We'll see a whole lotta things we simply don't understand
In this Tea Party Fox News Disneyland!
Even a hook to the face couldn't slow down my stride
Whenever you (whenever you) are by my side (are by my side)
 
Because you opened a tear in my heart (dear lady)
opened a tear in my heart... (in my heart)
Gotta pay back a debt and little darlin' you bet,
ya bet I shall (Pay it back I shall)
Oh yes, you opened a tear in my heart (dear lady),
opened a tear in my heart...
In every single branch of that causality tree
There will always be a you and there will always be me
So even at the bottom of the deep blue sea...
You will always... be my gal!
(Always be my gal)
My gal!

Bioshock Infinite can be described as an extremely story rich FPS. I mean, the game itself? Beautiful. The gameplay? Not many dull moments. There's a nice mixture of story and combat in this game it's all tied together incredibly. One of the best FPS I've ever played hands down. Story is amazing and will leave you wanting more. I hope they make another Bioshock game soon. I've played all three and this one was the best for me.

I really enjoyed this game. Admittedly, I'm not a fan of the first two games. I didn't think they had much of a story or world to dive into. You never really interacted with anyone. You're just all alone....which is part of the premise, I guess. I also played the remasters, and found the second to be unplayable with all the crashing.

I'm running this on a Ryzen 7 3700x, 32 gb of ram, an RTX 3070 8 gb, with all the settings maxed out.

The world here is beautiful. There's things to interact with, and see, that help hide the fact that the game is linear. There's a lot of design that had me enjoying taking a look around to enjoy the world.

Elizabeth is a great companion. She takes care of herself, and she keeps you supplied. I like the story with her and the way she's voiced. I really enjoyed her dynamic with you, and how the relationship grows during the game. She had me invested in hers, and the greater story.

Speaking of...I enjoyed the twist at the end. I enjoyed seeing the different worlds, and how little things changed everything. I'm also a fan of multiple reality stories. I love the path your character walks, and how he changes with it. It's great to see how Elizabeth became someone important to him, and to see his urge to protect her grow.

The shooting is Bioshock. Thee's not much different with it. The vigors/plasmids are mostly the same in value as well. I really enjoyed the Devil's Kiss. I found it far more useful than any of the ones in the first two games, especially after I upgraded it. I loved the rail system to get around. It made a lot of the combat so much more interesting. Having Elizabeth open tears to give you aid on the battlefield is also a nice touch. The guns had a decent variety, but I stuck mostly to the Carbine, with a random machine gun.

The gifts are hit, and mostly miss. I found most of them useless, and rarely changed them out after the first cache of them you find. At least there are options for players who want to play the game differently.

I must say that the ability to manually save being removed is a big letdown. I never noticed my game saving all that often, which led me to play it longer than I wanted at times. I've read that the game saves every few minutes or so, but I only ever noticed it unless I was moving areas. I miss the map as well.

I started the DLC, returning you to Rapture. It's really hard, as the game doesn't give you much to work with. I had to drop the difficulty to easy (I'm not a big fan of very hard games, as they take away from the story.) I really enjoy seeing Rapture when it was in it's glory...however, I'm still not a fan of it as a level to play through. That may be part of why I didn't like the first two.

All in all, I had a lot of fun with this one. It wan't a fantastic game, but it was enjoyable. It made the purchase of all the games in the series worth it to me. I know this is the usually the most disliked of the series, but it was well worth the play for me.

Yapılan olumlu yorumlara aldanarak büyük bir beklenti ile oyunu satın aldım. Şişirilmiş bir balondan başka hiçbir şey değil. Aldığı puanı kesinlikle haketmiyor. Tam bir hayal kırıklığı ve oynarken inanılmaz derecede sıkıldım. En fazla 2 saat oynamaya dayanabildim. Herkes oyunun hikayesini övmüş ama oynarken bu hikayenin zerresini hissetmiyorsunuz. Tek anladığınız kızı kurtarmaya çalıştığınız. Ben kimim, nerdeyim, ne yapıyorum hiçbir şey anlamadan karşınıza çıkan ne olduğu belirsiz karakterleri öldürüyorsunuz. Oyun öldür ve ilerle mantığından ibaret. FPS oyunlarında en önemli detaylardan biri vuruş hissidir. Vuruş hissiyatı atarilerde oynadığımız ördek vurma oyunu ile eşdeğer kalitede ve silah sesleri rezalet. Oyunu uzatmak adına her noktaya loot pompalamışlar. İtem bulduğunuza sevinmiyorsunuz bile. Herşey çok basit ve yapmacık. Oyunun tek iyi yanı büyük bir görsel şölen var. Unreal Engine nimetleri son sınırına kadar kullanılmış. Atmosfer fena değil. Animasyonlar çok iyi, ciddi anlamda özenilmiş fakat bir oyunu oynayabilmek için bunlar yeterli değil. Oyuna bağlanmak gerekir fakat bu oyun ciddi anlamda sıkıcı. Kesinlikle tavsiye etmiyorum.

[h1][b]It isn't bad, but it is[/b][/h1]

To elaborate on the heading, I don't think it's a bad game in and of itself, but I do think it was a mistake for the franchise.

Infinite is certainly different from the first two titles and arguably worse in most areas.
From the convoluted story, to the ridiculous flying city, and just the lack of cohesion with the previous titles.

[h1][b]Setting/Universe[/b][/h1]
Looking back to earlier games, Rapture was at least realistic enough for a lot of players to buy into.
An underwater city built in the late 1940s to early 1950s isn't too far science-fiction for people to believe.
In Infinite however, we are expected to believe that somehow in the year 1893, 50+ years before Rapture, a flying city can be built... Seriously?
Don't bother trying to sell me with that [spoiler]"technically Rosalind Lutece used her big brain knowledge and research to discover quantum levitation to suspend the city"[/spoiler] bullsh*t.
The first two games laid out the foundation as to how realistic the universe was and Infinite pulled a classic prequel f*ck up and cheapened it beyond measure.

[h1][b]Story[/b][/h1]
[b]Part 1.)[/b]
I personally really, really despise the inclusion of [spoiler]alternate universes/time travel[/spoiler] in almost any medium, and I find it absolutely disgusting when it's introduced in an already established franchise(with a couple exceptions).
This is primarily where my hatred of the story comes in; I just don't like these types of narratives. I suppose my simple monkey brain just doesn't like having to work this hard to figure out what I just watched.
I'm going to avoid going into any amount of detail, but those who know the twist know exactly what I'm talking about.
[b]Part 2.)[/b]
The second issue I have with the story is the inclusion of [spoiler]racism[/spoiler].
Why was this added? Who asked for Bioshock to include it? As much as the previous complaint felt unwelcome in Bioshock, this one takes the sh*t cake.
I get that the whole idea of Columbia is for the succession from the United States, sounds an awful lot like Bioshock 1 & 2's Rapture... wonder where they got the idea, but even then I don't see why they went this route. It seems like they brought aboard a young ambitious amateur writer to lead the entire narrative of Infinite.
And all of the propaganda/portrayals just left a bad taste in my mouth is all. Unnecessary.

[h1][b]Characters[/b][/h1]
[b]Booker DeWitt[/b] is pretty cut and dry at first glance with some interesting glimpses into his past throughout.
[spoiler]But once we see the big reveal towards the end, I lost any ounce of interest I had in the character.[/spoiler]
[b]Zachary Hale Comstock[/b] is a pretty bog standard antagonist with corrupt morals that can't be reasoned with.
[spoiler]And has to rely entirely on the twist to make him anything more. Weak character[/spoiler]
[b]Elizabeth[/b] is probably the only character I like with only a few moments that just had bad writing for the character.
[spoiler]That being said, her ability to create interdimensional tears is f*cking stupid.[/spoiler]
[b]The Lutece Twins[/b] are just bad. Absolutely the worst. Must've taken a real genius to write these two.
[spoiler]Going based off lore, they are the reason Columbia exists, therefore they are the reason this game exists.[/spoiler]

[h1][b]Conclusion[/b][/h1]
Bioshock Infinite sits off in it's own little corner; I really don't know what to say.
But to be fair to the game itself, I'm going to give it a score as if it wasn't linked to Bioshock, as if it were it's own game, an original IP.

[b]I give Bioshock Infinite a[/b]
[h1][b]7 out of 10[/b][/h1]
[b]If I'm judging it as a Bioshock title then I give it a[/b]
[h1][b]SHOULDN'T HAVE BEEN MADE[/b][/h1]


[b]Closing Thoughts[/b]
I feel like even the devs knew how much Infinite strayed away from the previous games and felt forced to revisit Rapture in the Burial at Sea DLC to appease fans.
Also, I can't help but notice how much Elizabeth was loved by the community.
I have a strong inclination that her character alone is what has made Bioshock Infinite as popular as it is.

A trilógia befejező, és teljessé tevő része (Bruial at Sea kiegészítők végett)! Nekem nem jött át annyira ez a rész, valószínűleg inkább a játékmenetbeli változások okán, mivel a történetre nem nagyon lehet panasz.
Például eléggé csőjáték hatása van (végül is az), az előző részek helyszínét Rapturet azért jóval szabadabban lehetett bejárni! A fegyverarzenál limitálását Elizabeth képességei sem dobták fel számomra, a harcok elég egysíkúak lettek, jórészt csak egy pisztolyt és a tűzbombát kellett használnom. 
A játékot mindenképp ajánlom, akciósan a trilógia 12 euró körül szokott lenni, összesített játékidejük kb 30 óra, amennyiben csak végigrohansz rajtuk, ennyi pénzért best buy!
